title: Windows 10 Language Interface Packs (x86-x64)
description:
Windows 10 Language Interface Packs (x86-x64)

About this release

Source: Microsoft OEM untouched ISO images
Apply to: any edition of Windows 10
Languages: Afrikaans, Albanian, Amharic, Armenian, Assamese, Azeri Latin, Bangla India, Basque, Belarusian, Bengali (Bangladesh), Bosnian Latin, Catalan, Central Kurdish (Arabic), Cherokee, Dari, Filipino, Galician, Georgian, Gujarati, Hausa Latin, Hindi, Icelandic, Igbo, Indonesian, Irish, isiXhosa, isiZulu, K`iche`, Kannada, Kazakh, Khmer, Kinyarwanda, Kiswahili, Konkani, Kyrgyz, Lao, Luxembourgish, Macedonian, Malay, Malayalam, Maltese, Maori, Marathi, Mongolian Cyrillic, Nepali, Norwegian Nynorsk, Odia, Persian, Punjabi, Punjabi (Arabic), Quechua, Scottish Gaelic, Serbian Cyrillic, Serbian Cyrillic Bosnia-Herzegovina, Sesotho sa Leboa, Setswana, Sindhi Arabic, Sinhala, Tajik (Cyrillic), Tamil, Tatar, Telugu, Tigrinya, Turkmen, Urdu, Uyghur, Uzbek Latin, Valencian, Vietnamese, Welsh, Wolof, Yoruba 

About Windows 10 Language Interface Pack (LIPs)

Language Interface Packs can be installed on any edition of Windows 10. They provide a translated version of only the most widely used dialog boxes, menu items, and help content.

Because the entire user interface is not translated, LIPs require at least one parent language. Untranslated parts of the user interface are displayed in the parent language.

For a list of supported parent languages, see available Language Packs for Windows http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/language-packs#lptabs=win10.

When you install a LIP:

- You get the parent language requirements for that language.
- The parent language pack must be installed before the LIP can be installed.
- You can install more than one LIP, so each user of the computer can display the user interface in a different language.
